TITLE: Tesla rallies after Canaccord upgrades rating, says it is like Apple
DESCRIPTION: Shares of Tesla climbed 3% on Monday after Canaccord Genuity raised its rating on the electric car maker to "buy" and compared its brand to Apple.

TITLE: Uber, PayPal, Walgreens launch $11 million vaccine rides fund
DESCRIPTION: Uber Technologies Inc, PayPal Holdings Inc and Walgreens Inc on Monday said they launched an $11 million fund to provide free ride-hail trips to U.S. COVID-19 vaccination sites for people who lack access to transportation.

TITLE: Some early Ford Mustang Mach-E owners suffer dead batteries
DESCRIPTION: Early owners of Ford Motor Co's newest electric vehicle, the Mustang Mach-E crossover, have experienced a battery problem that leaves their vehicles unable to start after charging, according to a service bulletin filed by Ford with the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration...

TITLE: Porsche can not rule out production cuts over chip shortage: Handelsblatt
DESCRIPTION: Volkswagen's luxury sports car unit Porsche AG might have to adjust production to reflect an ongoing shortage of crucial automotive chips, Handelsblatt reported.

TITLE: White House sees great focus on semiconductor chip shortage
DESCRIPTION: The Biden administration has put a big focus on addressing an ongoing shortage of semiconductors that are used in a range of devices from cars to computers, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said on Thursday.

TITLE: Michelin looks beyond tyres to help drive growth
DESCRIPTION: France's Michelin plans to add about 14 billion euros ($17 billion) to its annual revenues by 2030, by recovering from a pandemic-induced slowdown and diversifying beyond its tyre-making heritage into new activities including hydrogen power and medical devices.

TITLE: Biden plan calls for $100 billion in new EV consumer rebates: email
DESCRIPTION: The Biden administration's $174 billion proposal to boost electric vehicles calls for $100 billion in new consumer rebates and $15 billion to build 500,000 new electric vehicle charging stations, according to a Transportation Department email sent to congressional staff...

TITLE: GM offers clues to technology aimed at slashing EV battery costs
DESCRIPTION: General Motors Co is testing a variety of battery chemistries, technologies and manufacturing processes aimed at slashing the cost of future electric vehicle batteries and reducing its dependence on such price-sensitive metals as cobalt, President Mark Reuss said on Wednesday...

TITLE: U.S. Senate readying legislation on semiconductors, Biden says
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Senate leaders are preparing to introduce legislation on semiconductors, President Joe Biden said on Wednesday as the nation wrestles with an ongoing shortage of the critical technology used in a range of devices from cars to computers.

TITLE: U.S. Senate readying legislation on semiconductors, Biden says
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Senate leaders are preparing to introduce legislation on semiconductors, President Joe Biden said on Wednesday as the nation wrestles with an ongoing shortage of the critical technology used in a range of devices from cars to computers.

TITLE: Nikola's fuel-cell development head exits, shares fall
DESCRIPTION: Nikola Corp said on Wednesday its fuel-cell development head, Jesse Schneider, has left the company to pursue opportunities in the hydrogen industry, sending shares of the electric-truck maker down 5%.

TITLE: Biden willing to negotiate on corporate taxes, but 'sick and tired' of non-payers
DESCRIPTION: President Joe Biden on Wednesday made a fiery appeal for U.S companies to foot most of the bill for his $2 trillion-plus infrastructure plan, but signaled an openness to negotiate over exactly how much they would have to pay.

TITLE: Biden White House in talks with airlines on vaccine passports; will issue guidance
DESCRIPTION: The Biden administration is in extended discussions with U.S. airlines and other travel industry groups to provide technical guidance for vaccine passports that could be used to ramp up international air travel safely, industry officials said.

TITLE: Uber dangles higher pay to lure U.S. drivers back, but warns it will not last
DESCRIPTION: Uber Technologies Inc said U.S. drivers on their ride-hail platforms should take advantage of pay hikes as trip demand temporarily outstrips driver supply, but warned the windfall will not last.

TITLE: GM to start making Silverado electric pickups late next year in Detroit: source
DESCRIPTION: General Motors Co is planning to start production of Chevrolet Silverado electric pickup truck late next year at its Detroit-Hamtramck assembly plant, a source familiar with the U.S. automaker's plan said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Ryanair says Air France bailout to damage competition for decades
DESCRIPTION: A recapitalisation of Air France-KLM that will see France more than double its stake to nearly 30% will damage competition for decades to come, Europe's largest low-cost carrier Ryanair said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Transat sinks 22% after Air Canada scraps buyout deal
DESCRIPTION: Transat's shares slumped more than 22% on Monday after Air Canada scrapped its C$188.7 million ($150.83 million) buyout deal for the tour operator due to antitrust hurdles in Europe.

TITLE: Ford resumes political donations after review
DESCRIPTION: Ford Motor Co will resume making political donations and will not rule out donations to those lawmakers who voted on Jan. 6 against certifying President Joe Biden's election win, according to a letter from Ford seen by Reuters.

TITLE: Honda to resume normal North American production April 5
DESCRIPTION: Honda Motor Co said on Thursday it will resume normal production on April 5 at its automobile, engine and transmission plants in North America after production cuts impacted all of its U.S., Mexican and Canadian auto plants.

TITLE: U.S. automakers post higher quarterly sales even as chip shortage bites
DESCRIPTION: Automakers on Thursday reported a rebound in first-quarter U.S. sales from a coronavirus-induced slump last year, but volumes were capped by a global chip scarcity that forced many companies to cut production.

TITLE: Ford to provide update on financial impact of chip shortage next month
DESCRIPTION: Ford Motor Co said on Wednesday, while announcing the latest North America production cuts at seven assembly plants due to the global chip shortage, that it would provide an update on April 28 to the expected hit to its 2021 profit.

TITLE: Congress embarks on epic battle over Biden infrastructure plan
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. Congress is poised for a long battle over President Joe Biden's infrastructure investment plan as Democrats argue with Republicans and among themselves over the $2 trillion cost and how the money should be parceled out in coming years.

TITLE: McConnell signals opposition to Biden infrastructure bill
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell signaled opposition to President Joe BidenÃ¢ÂÂs $2 trillion infrastructure package on Wednesday, saying he would not support "massive tax increases" or spending that could balloon the federal debt.

TITLE: Volkswagen regrets how Voltswagen campaign was perceived
DESCRIPTION: Volkswagen on Wednesday said it regretted how its Voltswagen marketing stunt was perceived, a day after pulling an official statement announcing it as the new name for its U.S. division.

TITLE: U.S. agency urges some GM van owners to park outside pending recall
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said owners of about 10,000 new General Motors vans should park outside because of fire risks pending recall repairs.

TITLE: Volkswagen will not change name of U.S. operations: sources
DESCRIPTION: Volkswagen AG's U.S. unit will not change its name even after the German automaker issued a statement on Tuesday saying it would, three sources briefed on the matter said.

TITLE: Stellantis to add Peugeot 308, Opel Astra to electrified range this year
DESCRIPTION: Stellantis, the world's fourth largest carmaker, plans to offer an electric version of the Opel Astra and a hybrid Peugeot 308 among new additions to its electrified range this year.

TITLE: American Airlines readies more jets to meet rising demand
DESCRIPTION: American Airlines said on Monday it expects to fly most of its fleet in the coming months thanks to strong domestic and short-haul international bookings as COVID-19 infection rates and hospitalizations decline and more people receive vaccines.

TITLE: U.S. seeks input on licensing rules for information tech security
DESCRIPTION: The Biden administration said Friday it wants new public input on establishing licensing or other procedures to help companies comply with a sweeping new rule targeting Chinese technology firms.

TITLE: Volkswagen CEO says no high priority for Porsche AG: FAZ
DESCRIPTION: A possible listing of luxury division Porsche AG is not at the top of the agenda of Volkswagen, Chief Executive Herbert Diess told Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung in an interview.

TITLE: Lordstown Motors says SEC requests information on merger, vehicle preorders
DESCRIPTION: Lordstown Motors Corp said on Thursday that it has received a request from the Securities and Exchange Commission for information related to its merger with blank-check company DiamondPeak Holdings and pre-orders of its vehicles.

TITLE: UK electric van startup Arrival plans more microfactories this year - executives
DESCRIPTION: British electric van and bus startup Arrival Ltd will announce investments in more "microfactories" throughout 2021 as it expands its global manufacturing presence, executives said on Thursday.

TITLE: Tesla urges court to reinstate hike in emissions penalties
DESCRIPTION: Tesla Inc is pressing a U.S. appeals court to immediately reinstate a 2016 Obama regulation more than doubling penalties for automakers who fail to meet fuel efficiency requirements, according to court filings.

TITLE: Ignore ministers and book your holiday, Ryanair boss says
DESCRIPTION: British tourists should go ahead and book foreign holidays despite government warnings not to, Ryanair boss Michael O'Leary said on Wednesday, as the low-cost carrier announced plans to run 80% of its peak summer capacity.

TITLE: Tesla's in-car cameras raise privacy concerns: Consumer Reports
DESCRIPTION: Tesla Inc's use of in-car cameras to record and transmit video footage of passengers to develop self-driving technology raises privacy concerns, influential U.S. magazine Consumer Reports said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Volkswagen says Gernot Doellner becomes new strategy chief
DESCRIPTION: Volkswagen said on Tuesday Porsche AG executive Gernot Doellner will become the carmaker's new strategy chief from May 1.

TITLE: Tesla rallies after Ark Invest predicts $3,000 stock price
DESCRIPTION: Shares of Tesla jumped over 6% on Monday, getting a lift from a bullish report from Ark Invest, an influential shareholder in the electric car maker.

TITLE: Soccer: Man Utd swap shirt sponsor Chevrolet for TeamViewer
DESCRIPTION: Manchester United will sport German software firm TeamViewer's logo on their shirts from next season, drawing a line under a deal carmaker Chevrolet which has sponsored them for the past seven years.

TITLE: Nike set to overcome short-term shipping woes, most analysts say
DESCRIPTION: The supply chain hiccups that dented Nike Inc's third quarter sales are mostly behind them, analysts said on Friday, after executives said the sporting goods giant had adjusted inventories and other areas to avoid a recurrence.

TITLE: Porsche AG's Meschke: advantages of IPO have been laid out
DESCRIPTION: Volkswagen luxury unit Porsche AG is open to the idea of a potential stock market listing, with finance chief Lutz Meschke saying the advantages of such a move had been laid out.

TITLE: U.S. safety agency reviewing 23 Tesla crashes, three from recent weeks
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. auto safety agency disclosed on Thursday it has opened 27 investigations into crashes of Tesla vehicles, 23 of which remain active, and at least three of the crashes occurred in recent weeks.

TITLE: Exclusive: U.S. looks to Canada for minerals to build electric vehicles - documents
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. government is working to help American miners and battery makers expand into Canada, part of a strategy to boost regional production of minerals used to make electric vehicles and counter Chinese competitors.

TITLE: Air taxi startup Volocopter eyes fresh capital, SPAC an option: CEO
DESCRIPTION: German air taxi startup Volocopter plans to raise fresh funds from investors, its Chief Executive Florian Reuter said on Thursday, adding that a deal to go public via a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC) was one option.

TITLE: Travel on U.S. roads fell 11.3% in January over 2020 levels
DESCRIPTION: Travel on U.S. roads fell by 11.3%, or 28.2 billion miles in January compared with the same month last year as millions of Americans continue to work at home and skip leisure trips amid COVID-19.

TITLE: Honda's Mexican auto plants join North American pause from March 18
DESCRIPTION: Japanese carmaker Honda Motor Co will temporarily suspend production at its plants in Mexico beginning on March 18 due to supply chain problems related in part to pandemic disruptions, a company spokesperson said Wednesday.

TITLE: Airline consolidation set back five years, IATA chief says
DESCRIPTION: The large-scale government intervention in airlines triggered by the coronavirus crisis will hold back sector consolidation for up to five years, the head of global industry body IATA predicted on Wednesday.

TITLE: Toyota, Honda cut North America production amid supply chain woes
DESCRIPTION: Toyota Motor Corp and Honda Motor Co Ltd announced on Wednesday new North American production cuts, citing supply chain issues that have wreaked havoc with the auto industry.

TITLE: Volkswagen overtakes SAP to become Germany's most valuable blue-chip
DESCRIPTION: Volkswagen overtook software maker SAP on Wednesday as the most valuable company in Germany's blue-chip DAX index, as investors warm to the carmaker's plans to take on Tesla.

TITLE: Chip shortage to hit March production at Volvo Cars in China, U.S
DESCRIPTION: Volvo Cars, which is owned by China's Geely Holding, will temporarily stop or adjust production in China and the United States for parts of March due to a global shortage of semiconductor chips, it said on Wednesday.

TITLE: U.S. travel spending sank 42% in 2020 due to pandemic: industry group
DESCRIPTION: Travel spending by Americans plunged by 42%, or $492 billion, in 2020, according to a report by an industry group, amid social, travel and business restrictions aimed at curbing the spread of COVID-19.

TITLE: Volkswagen is worth 200 billion euros, CEO Diess says
DESCRIPTION: Volkswagen, the world's No.2 carmaker, is worth 200 billion euros ($238 billion), Chief Executive Herbert Diess, confirming a previously stated target on the back of a 38% share price increase so far in 2021.

TITLE: German solar car firm Sono Motors explores U.S. stock market listing: sources
DESCRIPTION: German solar car firm Sono Motors is exploring a U.S. stock market listing that may value the company at more than $1 billion, people close to the matter said.

TITLE: GM builds pickups without certain modules due to global chip shortage, hurting fuel economy
DESCRIPTION: General Motors Co said on Monday that due to the global semiconductor chip shortage the U.S. automaker is building certain 2021 light-duty full-size pickup trucks without a fuel management module, hurting those vehicles' fuel economy performance.

TITLE: Tesla investor sues Musk, claims tweets violate SEC settlement
DESCRIPTION: Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk has been sued by a shareholder who accused him of violating his 2018 settlement with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission over his Twitter use.

TITLE: Ford Motor nominates two younger Ford family members for board of directors
DESCRIPTION: Ford Motor Co on Friday nominated two younger Ford family members to its board of directors, continuing a presence among the directors for the family that founded the U.S. automaker.

TITLE: Renault to sell its stake in Daimler to reduce debt
DESCRIPTION: French carmaker Renault said on Thursday it would sell all of its 1.54% stake in Germany's Daimler in order to speed up de-leveraging of its automotive business.

TITLE: Alfa Romeo and Lancia brands to enjoy stronger investments under Stellantis: Elkann
DESCRIPTION: Former Fiat Chrysler premium car brands Alfa Romeo and Lancia will enjoy stronger investments under Stellantis, the new automaker formed from the merger with France's PSA, Stellantis Chairman John Elkann said in a TV interview.

TITLE: Uber, Lyft agree to share info on banned drivers in safety push
DESCRIPTION: Uber Technologies Inc and Lyft Inc on Thursday said they would share with each other information on drivers and delivery workers they had banned from their platforms for the most serious incidents in an effort to boost safety.

TITLE: GM says U.S. should extend consumer, investment tax credits to boost electric vehicles
DESCRIPTION: General Motors President Mark Reuss said Thursday the U.S. government should extend new investment tax credits for electric vehicle manufacturing and supply chains and expand consumer incentives to electric vehicle purchases, including for used vehicles.

TITLE: VW-backed EV charging firm Ionity to sell minority stake: sources
DESCRIPTION: Electric vehicle charging group Ionity, whose owners include Volkswagen and Daimler, is looking to sell a minority stake to rake in 400 million-500 million euros ($479 million-597 million), three people familiar with the matter said.

TITLE: GM announces partnership with lithium metal battery startup
DESCRIPTION: General Motors Co on Thursday announced a partnership with a lithium metal battery startup to boost the U.S. automaker's battery development, allowing for higher electric vehicle driving range in a smaller package.

TITLE: LG Energy Solution to invest $4.5 billion in U.S. battery production
DESCRIPTION: South Korea's LG Energy Solution plans to invest more than $4.5 billion in its U.S. battery production business over the next four years, including plans to build at least two new plants, a senior executive said on Thursday.

TITLE: Deutsche Bank nominates retiring VW CFO to board
DESCRIPTION: Deutsche Bank said on Thursday it had nominated Volkswagen's retiring finance chief to its supervisory board, coming at a time that the lender is trying to increase its ties market share as a banker for European corporations.

TITLE: Volkswagen hikes battery cell demand in aggressive EV expansion
DESCRIPTION: Volkswagen requires about 300 gigawatt hours (GWh) worth of battery cells a year by the end of the decade for its ambitious roll out of electric vehicles in Europe, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

TITLE: Exclusive: LG hopes to make new battery cells for Tesla in 2023 in U.S. or Europe - sources
DESCRIPTION: LG Energy Solution aims to build advanced battery cells for Tesla Inc electric vehicles in 2023 and is considering potential production sites in the United States and Europe, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

TITLE: Tesla surges almost 20%, biggest daily rise in a year
DESCRIPTION: Shares of electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc surged nearly 20% on Tuesday, rebounding from a deep selloff with its largest daily gain in a year after data showed an increase in China sales and an analyst raised his rating on the stock.

TITLE: Short-sellers made billions from U.S. tech selloff, GameStop inflicts losses: Ortex
DESCRIPTION: Investors are estimated to have made billions of dollars from their bearish bets on Tesla and big tech stocks in the recent knee-jerk selloff triggered by a jump in U.S. Treasury yields, data from financial analytics firm Ortex showed on Tuesday.

TITLE: U.S. judge approves Daimler's $1.5 billion diesel emissions settlement
DESCRIPTION: A federal judge on Tuesday approved Daimler AG's $1.5 billion settlement to resolve a U.S. government probe into the German automaker's use of undisclosed software that allowed excess diesel pollution to be emitted by 250,000 of its vehicles in the United States.

TITLE: Tesla loses a third of its value for the third time in a year
DESCRIPTION: Tesla Inc's stock extended losses on Monday and is now down by a third from its January record high, making it the third time in about a year that the electric car maker's shares have corrected that dramatically.

TITLE: U.S. sues EZ Lynk for selling vehicle emissions defeat devices
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. government on Monday sued automobile device manufacturer EZ Lynk for selling tens of thousands of "defeat devices" that enabled car and truck owners to disable their vehicles' computerized emission controls at the push of a button.

TITLE: Tesla loses more than quarter of a trillion in a month as rally fizzles
DESCRIPTION: Shares of Tesla Inc closed lower for a fifth consecutive session on Monday, caught in a tech-led selloff that has wiped more than $277 billion off the company's market value over the last month.

TITLE: Mexico auto output dives in February amid bad weather, chip shortages
DESCRIPTION: Mexican automotive production and exports tumbled in February, data from the national statistics agency (INEGI) showed on Friday, hit by temporary closures of factories due to bad weather and a global semiconductor chip shortage.

TITLE: U.S. Senate Democrats to offer plan to alter jobless benefits in COVID-19 aid bill
DESCRIPTION: Liberal and moderate Democrats reached a deal that would scale back federal unemployment benefits in a COVID-19 aid bill to $300 per week, from the proposed $400, a Senate Democratic aide said on Friday.

TITLE: Just 12% of Americans plan spring break travel - industry
DESCRIPTION: U.S. travel demand remains low even as tens of millions of Americans get vaccinated for COVID-19, with just 12% planning a spring break trip this year, the industry said on Thursday.

TITLE: Biden meets with U.S. lawmakers on infrastructure push
DESCRIPTION: President Joe Biden met on Thursday for more than an hour with a bipartisan group of lawmakers on the White House's planned pursuit of a massive jump in spending on projects to restore crumbling U.S. infrastructure.

TITLE: New Caledonia agrees to Vale nickel mine sale, Tesla to be partner
DESCRIPTION: Political leaders in New Caledonia on Thursday agreed new terms for the sale of Vale's nickel business, including a majority stakeholding for local interests, seeking to resolve unrest over the planned sale.

TITLE: Explainer: Honda unveils its new level 3 technology, but how does it work?
DESCRIPTION: Honda Motor Co Ltd unveiled on Thursday a limited batch of its flagship Legend sedan this week, becoming the world's first carmaker to sell a vehicle equipped with certified level 3 self-driving technology.

TITLE: California startup touts battery-swapping to juice demand for electric vehicles
DESCRIPTION: Ample, a seven-year-old San Francisco startup, wants to skirt one of the big hurdles to widespread adoption of electric vehicles by reviving the idea of quick, automated battery swaps for owners concerned about running out of juice while driving.

TITLE: Volkswagen CEO tweets, Musk-style, on market-cap milestone
DESCRIPTION: When the market value of Germany's Volkswagen briefly rose above the 100-billion-euro mark on Wednesday for the first time since 2015, the boss of the normally staid carmaker took to Twitter, Elon Musk-style, to crow about it.

TITLE: Texan chipmakers face slow recovery from power crisis as shortage looms
DESCRIPTION: Chipmakers like Samsung Electronics Co Ltd will need a couple of weeks to resume production in Texas after shutdowns caused by severe weather, and customers could face knock-on effects in several months' time, a representative of a trade body said.

TITLE: Top U.S. utilities collaborate to build electric vehicle charging stations
DESCRIPTION: Six major utilities unveiled a plan on Tuesday to add electric vehicle fast chargers to connect major highway systems across United States, as they look to cater to the burgeoning electric vehicle market.

TITLE: To go electric, America needs more mines. Can it build them?
DESCRIPTION: Last September, in the arid hills of northern Nevada, a cluster of flowers found nowhere else on earth died mysteriously overnight.

TITLE: Two U.S. men charged with aiding Ghosn's escape land in Japan
DESCRIPTION: An American father and son accused of helping former Nissan Motor Co Ltd Chairman Carlos Ghosn flee Japan arrived in Tokyo on Tuesday to face questioning from prosecutors and the prospect of charges that could carry a three-year prison term.

TITLE: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles pleads guilty in U.S. labor probe
DESCRIPTION: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles pleaded guilty on Monday to charges it conspired with company executives to make illegal, lavish gifts to United Auto Workers (UAW) leaders and undermined workersÃ¢ÂÂ confidence in collective bargaining.

TITLE: Workhorse to meet USPS on Wednesday to discuss loss of delivery contract
DESCRIPTION: Workhorse Group Inc shares rose after it disclosed it will meet with U.S. Postal Service on Wednesday after the electric-vehicle maker lost a multibillion-dollar contract to Oshkosh Defense for making postal delivery vehicles last week.

TITLE: Daimler picks banks to help with listing of trucks unit - sources
DESCRIPTION: Daimler has picked banks to help with the planned listing of its trucks unit that the carmaker seeks to increase its investor appeal as a focused electric, luxury car business, people close to the matter said.

TITLE: Ford CEO calls on U.S. government to support EV batteries, charging
DESCRIPTION: Ford Motor Co's Chief Executive on Wednesday called on the U.S. government to support battery production and charging infrastructure development, as he outlined the automaker's plan to develop electric platforms for its top-selling trucks, vans and SUVs.

TITLE: Lyft focuses on aged citizens with feature to book rides by call
DESCRIPTION: Lyft Inc introduced a service on Wednesday that would let users request a ride by call, without needing the app, in a bid to make its ride-hailing service more convenient for senior citizens.

TITLE: Knorr-Bremse, Lufthansa mogul Thiele dies at 79
DESCRIPTION: German braking systems maker Knorr-Bremse said its majority shareholder Heinz Hermann Thiele, who shaped the company since buying it from his then-employer in 1985, has died unexpectedly at the age of 79.

TITLE: Musk's SpaceX raises $850 million in equity financing
DESCRIPTION: Billionaire Elon Musk's SpaceX has raised about $850 million in equity financing, the private rocket launch service said in a regulatory filing on Tuesday.

TITLE: Exclusive: CDP consortium's bid to value Atlantia unit at 9 billion euros - sources
DESCRIPTION: Cassa Depositi e Prestiti (CDP) on Tuesday gave the go-ahead to submit an offer to buy Atlantia's 88% stake in Autostrade per l'Italia unit, CDP said, after two sources told Reuters the bid would value 100% of Autostrade at 9 billion euros.

TITLE: Lucid Motors' SPAC skids as $56 billion valuation sparks bubble concerns
DESCRIPTION: Shares of Churchill Capital IV Corp fell more than 40% on Tuesday, as its merger with electric vehicle maker Lucid Motors sparked concerns about the real worth of the company which has yet to start regular production.

TITLE: U.S. House budget panel approves $1.9 trillion COVID-19 aid bill
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. House of Representatives Budget Committee on Monday approved legislation with $1.9 trillion in new coronavirus relief, advancing a top priority of President Joe Biden toward a full House vote on passage expected later this week.

TITLE: Volkswagen in Mexico to suspend Jetta production on Monday and Tuesday
DESCRIPTION: Volkswagen's Mexico unit said on Friday that a work stoppage on its Jetta model will continue on Monday and Tuesday, due to an ongoing shortage of natural gas.

TITLE: Aeromexico says has requested final disbursements of $675 million: statement
DESCRIPTION: Mexican airline Aeromexico said in a statement on Friday that it has requested final preferential financing disbursements of $675 million as part of the company's restructuring plans that will boost liquidity.

TITLE: Automakers pause North American production on U.S. winter weather
DESCRIPTION: Freezing weather that interrupted gas supplies in the southern United States and Mexico was wreaking havoc on Thursday on car manufacturing plants on both sides of the border, with Ford Motor Co, Nissan Motor Co Ltd and Toyota Motor Corp reporting disruptions to their assembly...

TITLE: Retail trading boom sparks 500%-plus rally in small German brokers
DESCRIPTION: The retail trading boom has fired up the stocks of some small German brokers, including one run by around 50 people, which reported a 10-fold rise in annual profit after an almost similar jump in its share price in less than a year.

TITLE: Toyota investing $210 million to expand West Virginia engine production
DESCRIPTION: Toyota Motor Corp said Thursday it is investing $210 million to expand engine production in West Virginia and add 100 new jobs.

TITLE: Volkswagen mulls listing of Porsche AG unit: source
DESCRIPTION: Volkswagen is considering a listing of its luxury car division Porsche AG to rake in cash needed for the group's shift towards software and electric vehicles, a person familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

TITLE: Men charged in Ghosn escape plot ask U.S. State Department to halt extradition - letter
DESCRIPTION: An American father and son accused of helping former Nissan Motor Co Ltd Chairman Carlos Ghosn flee trial in Japan have asked U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken to halt their impending extradition to the East Asian country.

TITLE: Chip shortage could impact nearly 1 million vehicles of production in first quarter - IHS
DESCRIPTION: A shortage of auto semiconductor chips could impact nearly 1 million units of global light vehicle production in the first quarter, data firm IHS Markit said on Tuesday, significantly upping a prior forecast.

TITLE: Exclusive: Lucid Motors nears SPAC deal as Klein launches financing - sources
DESCRIPTION: Luxury electric vehicle maker Lucid Motors Inc is getting close to a deal to go public at a roughly $12-billion valuation after veteran dealmaker Michael Klein's blank-check acquisition firm launched a financing effort to back the transaction, people familiar with the matter...

TITLE: From FedEx to GM, firms halt operations as freeze grips parts of United States
DESCRIPTION: Many U.S companies, including FedEx and General Motors, were forced to temporarily shut operations on Tuesday as a bone-chilling winter storm caused power outages and gas shortages in parts of the country.

TITLE: Carlos Ghosn's accused escape plotters ask U.S. Supreme Court to delay extradition to Japan
DESCRIPTION: Lawyers for two men accused of helping former Nissan Motor Co Ltd Chairman Carlos Ghosn flee Japan while awaiting trial on financial charges have asked the U.S. Supreme Court to intervene and delay their extradition.

TITLE: U.S. court clears way for extradition to Japan of Ghosn's accused escape plotters
DESCRIPTION: A U.S. appeals court on Thursday declined to further delay the extradition to Japan of two men charged with helping former Nissan Motor Co Ltd Chairman Carlos Ghosn flee the country.

TITLE: Ford CEO calls for settlement between LG Chem, SK Innovation
DESCRIPTION: Ford Motor Co's chief executive, Jim Farley, on Thursday publicly encouraged South Korea's chemicals and electric vehicle (EV) battery maker LG Chem Ltd and SK Innovation Co Ltd to reach a settlement on LG's battery allegations that SK stole trade secrets.

TITLE: Uber CEO dismisses bitcoin investment, could use for transactions: CNBC
DESCRIPTION: Uber Technologies Chief Executive Dara Khosrowshahi said on Thursday that the company discussed and "quickly dismissed" the idea of investing in bitcoin but told CNBC the ride-hailing company could potentially accept the cryptocurrency as payment.

TITLE: Twitter has thought about holding bitcoin, not decided yet: CNBC
DESCRIPTION: Twitter Inc has thought about whether to hold bitcoin on its balance sheet, but has not made any changes yet, the social media platform's chief financial officer, Ned Segal, told CNBC on Wednesday.

TITLE: Daimler Trucks chief says clean trucks will be ready before clean fuels
DESCRIPTION: Daimler Trucks could have a full line of zero-emission commercial vehicles ready by 2027, ahead of most proposed deadlines for phasing out internal combustion engines, but deploying them will depend on infrastructure investments that have not yet been made, the Daimler AG...

TITLE: Uber and Lyft's long wait for a rebound in demand signals slow economic recovery
DESCRIPTION: With the pandemic still suppressing ridesharing demand, Wall Street is keen to know how soon Uber Technologies Inc and Lyft Inc expect a rebound and how they plan to keep costs under control until then.

TITLE: Musk-fuelled bitcoin surge triggers cryptocurrency exchange glitches
DESCRIPTION: Major cryptocurrency exchanges experienced technical issues on Monday as trading volumes soared after billionaire Elon Musk's Tesla Inc revealed it had purchased $1.5 billion of bitcoin and would soon accept it as a form of payment.

TITLE: Tesla announces $1.5 billion bitcoin bet, makes payments pledge
DESCRIPTION: Tesla Inc said on Monday it had invested around $1.5 billion in bitcoin and expected to begin accepting payment for its cars and other products with it in the near future, prompting a more than 10% jump in the electronic currency.

TITLE: Wall Street Week Ahead: GameStop frenzy reveals potential for broader market stress
DESCRIPTION: As the trading frenzy in GameStop Corp shares and other social media favorites recedes, investors are eyeing signs of potential market stress that could weigh on broader stock performance in coming weeks.

TITLE: Ford's forecast in focus as it wraps up year with quarterly loss
DESCRIPTION: Ford Motor Co's investors are likely to brush aside the company's quarterly loss on Thursday and focus on its 2021 forecast and production target for the revamped F-150 pickup truck, a consistent bestseller in the U.S. automobile market.

TITLE: Daimler to spin off truck unit, sharpen investor focus on Mercedes-Benz
DESCRIPTION: German carmaker Daimler said on Wednesday it plans to spin off Daimler Truck, the world's largest truck and bus maker, as it seeks to increase its investor appeal as a focused electric, luxury car business, sending its shares up nearly 9%.

TITLE: Ford, Google join hands to offer cloud-based data services
DESCRIPTION: Ford Motor Co will tap into software, artificial intelligence and cloud computing offered by Alphabet Inc's Google to develop new consumer services and modernize internal operations, the companies said on Monday.

TITLE: GameStop third biggest short, even as shares shorted falls - S3 Partners
DESCRIPTION: Short interest in GameStop Corp, whose shares have skyrocketed this week, is at $11.2 billion, making it the third most shorted stock by value, although the number of shares shorted has declined, analytics firm S3 Partners said.

TITLE: New Toyota tech unit promises world's safest drive
DESCRIPTION: Toyota Motor Corp unveiled its Woven Planet research unit at a virtual media event on Friday, promising to deliver the world's "safest mobility" as competition heats up to develop self-driving and connected cars.

TITLE: American Airlines, Southwest post record losses and signal need for more aid
DESCRIPTION: American Airlines Group Inc and Southwest Airlines Co posted their biggest-ever annual losses on Thursday and indicated a need for additional government aid as the industry continues to reel from the coronavirus pandemic.

TITLE: GM aims to end sale of gasoline, diesel-powered cars, SUVs, light trucks by 2035
DESCRIPTION: General Motors Co said on Thursday it was setting a goal to sell all its new cars, SUVs and light pickup trucks with zero tailpipe emissions by 2035, a dramatic shift by the largest U.S. automaker away from gasoline and diesel engines.

TITLE: Tesla's report could trigger $7 billion payout to Musk
DESCRIPTION: Tesla's quarterly report on Wednesday could trigger a $7 billion options payout to Chief Executive Elon Musk, while owners of the electric car maker's soaring stock are keen to hear the company's target for 2021 deliveries.

TITLE: KLM to cut 1,000 more jobs, says mandatory COVID-19 testing will ground planes
DESCRIPTION: KLM said it would cut an additional 1,000 jobs in 2021 and warned on Thursday that government plans to require all passengers and crew to pass a COVID-19 test before flying to the Netherlands would ground its long-haul flights.

TITLE: U.S. agency orders Ford to recall 3 million vehicles over air bags
DESCRIPTION: Ford Motor Co must recall 3 million vehicles with potentially defective driver-side Takata air bags, the U.S. auto safety regulator said on Tuesday, rejecting a bid by the second-largest U.S. automaker to avoid a recall.

TITLE: Goldman Sachs to issue credit cards for General Motors
DESCRIPTION: Goldman Sachs Group Inc said on Friday it expects to become the issuing bank for automaker General Motors Co's credit card business, starting September this year.

TITLE: Tesla asks U.S. safety agency to declare speed display issue inconsequential
DESCRIPTION: Tesla Inc filed a petition with U.S. auto safety regulators saying that 612,000 vehicles produced since 2012 do not fully comply with federal safety standards because displays can be switched from miles per hour to only metric measurements, documents released on Friday show.

TITLE: Toyota settles U.S. probe into delayed emissions defect reports for $180 million
DESCRIPTION: Toyota Motor Corp settled a lengthy Justice Department civil probe into its delayed filing of emissions-related defect reports for $180 million, the government said on Thursday.

TITLE: American Airlines to offer COVID-19 vaccines to employees at hub airports, director says
DESCRIPTION: American Airlines plans to offer COVID-19 vaccines to its employees at medical clinics at its hub airports once they are available, with inoculation for Chicago-based employees possible as soon as next month, a director told Reuters.

TITLE: Look, up in the sky - it's a flying Cadillac! GM unveils futuristic vehicle
DESCRIPTION: General Motors Co on Tuesday presented a futuristic flying Cadillac - a self-driving vehicle which takes off and lands vertically and carries the passenger above the streets and through the air.

TITLE: Trump says Big Tech is dividing the country, after his supporters attack Congress
DESCRIPTION: President Donald Trump blamed Big Tech companies on Tuesday for dividing the country days after Twitter and Facebook banned him on their platforms for encouraging the attack on the U.S. Capitol building

TITLE: Uber expands "green trip" option to over 1,400 cities in North America
DESCRIPTION: Ride-hailing company Uber Technologies Inc said on Tuesday it was expanding its electric vehicle (EV) and hybrid ride option to over 1,400 new cities in North America.

TITLE: AT&T suspends donations to lawmakers who opposed Biden certification
DESCRIPTION: AT&T Inc, one of the largest U.S. political contributors, said Monday its political action committee will suspend donations to lawmakers that did not back the certification of President-elect Joe Biden' win last week.

TITLE: McConnell rules out quick vote on House bill for $2,000 COVID-19 relief checks
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said on Wednesday that the Senate would not move quickly to consider a bill from the House of Representatives that would raise direct coronavirus relief payments to Americans from $600 to $2,000.

TITLE: U.S. Senate to address Trump's request on stimulus checks - McConnell
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell on Tuesday said senators this week will address President Donald Trump's request that $2,000 stimulus checks be sent to Americans struggling during the COVID-19 pandemic.
